name: CI Deployment Failure
description: An automated CI tool failed to deploy an application.

name: Manual Deployment Failure
description: A user failed to deploy an application.

name: Internal Outage
description: An internal system used by employees has stopped working.

name: External Outage
description: A customer-facing system has stopped working.

name: Security Breach
description: A malicious third party has gained access to the organization's systems.

name: Data Breach
description: Personally Identifiable Information (PII) has been leaked from the organization.

name: Platform Outage
description: The platform that runs the systems has become degraded or stopped working.

name: Chaos Monkey
description: Incident triggered during chaos monkey game day.

name: Third Party
description: A third-party system or organization has become degraded or stopped working, causing issues.

name: Software Bug/Error
description: Incident caused by a software bug or unexpected error.

name: Performance Degradation
description: Incident related to decreased system performance or slow response times.

name: Infrastructure Failure
description: Incident caused by hardware or network failures.

name: Service Disruption
description: Incident that disrupts specific services or functionalities within the application.

name: Data Integrity Issue
description: Incident related to data corruption or data inconsistencies.

name: Service Level Agreement (SLA) Violation
description: Incident where the application fails to meet defined SLA requirements.

name: User Access/Authorization Issue
description: Incident related to user authentication, authorization, or access control problems.

name: Scheduled Maintenance
description: Incident occurring during planned maintenance activities.

name: Integration Failure
description: Incident caused by failures in integrating with external systems or APIs.

name: User Experience (UX) Issue
description: Incident related to usability, design, or user interface problems.

name: Other
description: For other incidents that don't fit the above options.
